column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-03-02 02:23:54+00:00; ;1366574959158382598;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Algie35 In my own personal experience
column3: all of that mental and emotional labor that comes with restrictive eating can quickly turn to shame when you break your diet
column4: and shame can lead to disordered eating.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2021-03-02 02:21:13+00:00; ;1366574281807695872;en;1;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Algie35 The mental
column3: emotional
column4: and physical labor involved in changing ones diet can be understandably overwhelming for someone who has chronic disability. And there’s also factors like time
column5: money
column6: and importantly access to good nutrition- which can be extra hard for disabled ppl too.

column3: I think it’s worth honoring that changing your diet is not like buying a pair of shoes- it is an involved lifestyle change impacting choices you make 3+ times a day.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 03:08:20+00:00; ;1334696010262593543;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Rock_The_Kaspar I stand by everything I wrote in my original tweet
column3: and I don’t think it’s too strongly worded. Men who really get it won’t be fragile to being called out on misogyny. And IMO triggering that fragility to talk about it is more effective than forever centering white male comfort.

column3: but IMO it seems likely that your experience of men/misogyny is heavily buffered by white privilege. Here are some women of color that explain the true meaning behind the phrase “men are trash”

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 02:43:05+00:00; ;1334689655925555208;en;1;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Nicole_Nonya @peabianjay This convo has gotten way off course
column3: but just one note that pedophiles are not the same as child molestors
column4: and the confusion and vilification of pedophilia as a valid mental disorder prevents people who could seek help for the condition from doing so and preventing harm.

column3: a lot of this “shun culture” is deeply rooted in racism
column4: white supremacy
column5: and ultimately anti-Blackness. It is not only white ppl who misuse cancel culture
column6: but the privilege to misuse it is still linked with white privilege. See also colorism

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 02:19:36+00:00; ;1334683742175051777;en;4;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Nicole_Nonya @peabianjay Social justice should be a safe space to discuss things
column3: and it feels like some white ppl are using the guise of cancel culture to make it seem unsafe on purpose so they can keep avoiding talking about the problems that continue to oppress marginalized every single day.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 02:18:13+00:00; ;1334683394999873538;en;2;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Nicole_Nonya @peabianjay I’m so much more annoyed by people who emotionally avoid politics than by people who say something wrong but are still trying. At least in the second instance
column3: it gets discussed and corrected.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 02:01:37+00:00; ;1334679218895011842;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Nicole_Nonya @peabianjay And those small “infractions” (ie understandable bids for survival) are rooted in a long history of systemic racism and sexism. Cancel culture is being co-opted by the toxic kyriarchy for sure.

column3: but a friend of mine wrote an awesome post about how “cancel culture” in the way it’s used by white people and white men is deeply rooted in the same shunning we show to prisoners (many Black people and POC) whom we’ve exiled over the smallest things.

column4: I mean their male fragility should not be centered in convos about intersectional feminism.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 01:29:08+00:00; ;1334671043546378240;en;0;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Rock_The_Kaspar As far as men and the patriarchy are concerned
column3: misogyny is the norm
column4: not the exception. And you can’t prove you’re the exception by perpetuating more misogyny.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 01:26:28+00:00; ;1334670371199410176;en;0;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Rock_The_Kaspar This is really underlined when they say things like this
column3: and I JUST HEARD THIS YESTERDAY. If you’re not a misogynist
column4: prove it by telling me what you love about women in your lives that has nothing to do with what they do for you. Prove it by not avoiding the feminist label.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 01:23:31+00:00; ;1334669631869517824;en;0;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Rock_The_Kaspar If men can stop being offended by this for more than 5 min
column3: they can realize that just because they don’t harbor conscious feelings of hatred toward women
column4: they can still partake in a system that hates and exploits women. Men’s feelings don’t need to be centered in feminism.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 01:21:50+00:00; ;1334669206512574470;en;0;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Rock_The_Kaspar My point here is that the broad brush is warranted. Just as we’ve been talking about how not being racist isn’t the same as being anti-racist
column3: not being sexist isn’t the same as being anti-sexist. Misogyny isn’t the insult you think it is
column4: it simply refers to the larger system.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 01:20:20+00:00; ;1334668831344640001;en;1;0;0;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Rock_The_Kaspar And I think it’s important to recognize that when we consider intersectionality
column3: the experience of misogyny is so much worse and more impactful for women of color
column4: queer women
column5: disabled women
column6: Black women
column7: and combos of all the above.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 01:18:30+00:00; ;1334668366817107968;en;1;0;2;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Rock_The_Kaspar If you love your wives
column3: mothers
column4: and daughters
column5: you wouldn’t just bring them up to avoid being called/known as a misogynist
column6: you would dismantle the systems that disenfranchise them in the first place. That starts with loving them for who they are
column7: not for what they do for you.

column2: PhD;PhD Climate Scientist 🌏 | Climate Action ≠ Climate Justice | Abolitionist | Korean American | Living in Busan 🇰🇷 | they/she;3127;Paciente;TEA;nan;nan;2020-12-04 01:15:25+00:00; ;1334667591156080642;en;2;0;1;0;Twitter for iPhone;@Rock_The_Kaspar The point I’m trying to emphasize with this tweet is that misogyny is more than just interpersonal hatred of women
